decks.notes: The key focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to outvalue your opponent. By controlling the board state and limiting your opponent's options, you can efficiently deploy threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Consign to Memory and Cling to Dust also provide additional utility and flexibility in disrupting your opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base and a variety of answers to different threats, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and control elements to disrupt opponents and control the board. It includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker, along with control spells like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The deck also includes ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talismans to help cast the high-cost Eldrazi creatures quickly. The goal is to use the Eldrazi creatures to dominate the battlefield and control the game until victory is achieved.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up quickly and efficiently using cards like Amulet of Vigor, Arboreal Grazer, and Explore to get to powerful creatures like Primeval Titan. Once Primeval Titan is out, the player can search for lands like Tolaria West, Vesuva, and Kessig Wolf Run to further ramp up and close out the game quickly. The deck also utilizes various utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to enhance its overall strategy and give it additional flexibility in different situations.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach along with various artifacts and spells to create a powerful combo that can lead to a quick win. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga are key pieces in the strategy, providing card advantage and ramp. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently, while also having disruption tools like Unholy Heat and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to control the game. The goal is to cycle through the deck, generate mana, and ultimately win the game through a powerful Breach combo.

The deck focuses on aggressive Boros creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game. It also uses the companion Jegantha to provide additional value and flexibility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, while using cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to control the board and finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison helps to protect the creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main goal of this deck is to control the game by utilizing Eldrazi creatures and powerful control spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to ramp quickly into casting large Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler, while also using cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to clear the opponent's board. The deck also utilizes Through the Breach as a way to cheat in Eldrazi creatures for a surprise finish.Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining board control and overpowering the opponent with massive threats.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, using a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra level of consistency to the deck. The deck is built around efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Galvanic Discharge to clear the way for attacks. The deck also features some powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to swiftly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an additional source of mana acceleration. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Galvanic Discharge, along with powerful creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, the deck can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The versatile sideboard options like Thoughtseize and Static Prison allow for adaptation to different matchups, enhancing the deck's flexibility and overall strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces of Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate a loop of recurring spells and artifacts from the graveyard. This allows the player to generate infinite mana and/or mill their entire library to win the game with either Thassa's Oracle or The One Ring. Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga serve as additional card advantage engines, while Unholy Heat and Malevolent Rumble provide removal and disruption against opponent's threats. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and combo off to win the game.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly and efficiently through aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Goblin Bombardment. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. With a mix of creature aggression and burn, this Mardu Aggro deck looks to close out games quickly and decisively.

This combo deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach card to repeatedly cast spells from your graveyard, allowing you to generate immense value and potentially win the game in a single turn. The deck includes cards like Twiddle, Hidden Strings, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to generate mana and untap lands, while also including Consign to Memory and The One Ring to disrupt your opponent's plans. With careful planning and efficient use of your resources, you can set up powerful combos and overwhelm your opponent with sheer card advantage and tempo.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive enchantments. The key strategy is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off the opponent. Blood Moon and Static Prison are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional value and synergy with the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Ulamog, the Defiler, and Emperor of Bones using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist. It also utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Psychic Frog to protect its key pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure fast, consistent plays. The inclusion of counterspells like Force of Negation and disruption cards like Thoughtseize adds versatility and control elements to the deck, allowing it to adapt to different matchups.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using fast creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also includes cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to be aggressive and proactive, using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to pump up creatures and push for a quick victory. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility to the deck. Overall, the key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage and disruption.

The deck focuses on a fast aggressive strategy, utilizing creatures with strong power and toughness to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards that prevent the opponent from blocking effectively, as well as burn spells to finish off the opponent or control the board. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha allows for additional mana fixing and ramp in the late game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a consistent stream of threats while controlling the board and limiting the opponent's options.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping up to play massive threats like Emrakul, Ulamog, and Devourer of Destiny. The deck also includes versatile cards like Ancient Stirrings and Through the Breach to find key pieces and cheat creatures into play. The combination of ramping, disruption, and game-winning threats makes this deck a formidable force in the Modern format, allowing players to take control of the game and dominate their opponents.
